turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Fort McKay First Nation.
turn.1: What was the land use of the Cree?
turn.2: Alexander Mackenzie who travelled from Montreal to the Arctic Ocean via the Methy Portage (see map) provided a detailed account of the "Kinisteneaux" (Cree) in 1789.
turn.3: What is the Athabasca Tribal Council?
turn.4: The Athabasca Tribal Council, represents the interests of Fort McKay First Nation, Athabasca Chipewyan First Nation, Chipewyan Prairie First Nation, Fort McMurray No. 468 First Nation and Mikisew Cree First Nation.
turn.5: How many people live on the council?
turn.6: These five First Nations of North Eastern Alberta include more than 5,000 Cree and Dene people.
turn.8: Treaty 8 was an agreement signed on June 21, 1899, between Queen Victoria and various First Nations of the Lesser Slave Lake area.
turn.10: The Treaty was signed just south of present-day Grouard, Alberta.
turn.11: How large is the area covered by the treaty?
turn.12: The land covered by Treaty 8, is larger than France and includes northern Alberta, northeastern British Columbia, northwestern Saskatchewan and a southernmost portion of the Northwest Territories.
